title: Torsten Carleman
summary: Torsten Carleman (8 July 1892, Visseltofta, Osby Municipality â€“ 11 January 1949, Stockholm), born Tage Gillis Torsten Carleman, was a Swedish mathematician, known for his results in classical analysis and its applications. As the director of the Mittag-Leffler Institute for more than two decades, Carleman was the most influential mathematician in Sweden.
